conclusion: To solve the problem, describe the image, identify containers and baffles, apply fluid flow concepts, and predict which container the liquid will reach.
The image shows liquid outlets A, B, C, and D, containers labeled E, F, and G, and baffles guiding liquid flow. Colored lines indicate liquid paths.
Liquid outlets A, B, C, and D are positioned at the top of the image.
Containers E, F, and G are positioned at the bottom of the image.
Baffles are angled structures positioned between outlets and containers to guide liquid flow.
Liquid from outlet A flows to container F, then to container G.
Liquid from outlet B flows to container F, then to container G.
Liquid from outlet C flows directly to container G.
Liquid from outlet D flows directly to container G.
All liquid paths converge at container G, regardless of the source outlet.
The final answer is container G.
